text: Franco Bracardi (16 May 1937 – 27 February 2005) was an Italian actor, composer, pianist and stand-up comedian. He was born in Rome and began working at night clubs by the early 1950s. Later, in the mid-1960s, he started composing songs for Mina, Mirelle Mathieu, Raffaella Carrà. During those same years, he started work as an actor and comedian. ==References== Category:Italian musicians Category:20th-century Italian composers Category:Stand-up comedians Category:Actors from Rome Category:1937 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Italian comedians
title: Franco Bracardi
